Some Believe Only What They Understand.--There are men who proudly boast that they believe only what they can understand. But the folly of their vaunted wisdom is apparent to every thoughtful mind. There are mysteries in human life and in the manifestations of God's power in the works of nature--mysteries which the deepest philosophy, the most extensive research, is powerless to explain.--RH, Sept 14, 1886.
